result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher A. Scott was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Maintain Drug Trafficking Place, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.42(1).
  • Possess w/Intent-Cocaine (>15-40g), a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(cm)3.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Neglecting a Child (No Harm and Child < 6 Yrs or Disability)

superMiscConds.notes:
Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Submit to random urine screens and pay for same.

Maintain absolute sobriety except for prescriptions taken in prescribed doses.  

Submit a DNA sample and pay surcharge.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.
AODA assessment and follow through counseling.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
10:52 AM Prosecuting attorney Anthony A. Lambrecht appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Christopher A. Scott appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Joseph Michael Pozorski Jr. appeared by video for Christopher A. Scott. 
Defendant waives his/her right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 3 for trial.
Inducement received.
ARRAIGNMENT - 
Information filed. Copy served on defense counsel.
Not guilty plea(s) entered.  Jury calendar.
Offer deadline 05-27-2022
Further proceedings scheduled for May 27, 2022 at 08:29 am.

Defendant in custody.   
Defendant demands a preliminary hearing and waives the statutory time period within which a preliminary hearing must be held.   Preliminary hearing is set for 04-21-22 at 10:30 a.m.   
Minutes.
Preliminary hearing on April 21, 2022 at 10:30 am.
By Attorney Joseph Pozorski Jr.

Adjustment Number: 22A 060774,
Payable Number: 154645,
Receipt Number: 22R 004136,
Amount: $20.00
Victim Identification Key.
Re:  Child Neglect, on 03-21-22.
Order to report to TRPD for photo and prints
Commitment for Failure to Furnish Bail.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crime of maintain drug trafficking place, possess cocaine, possess THC with intent to deliver, possess drug paraphernalia, bail jumping and child neglect.  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 03-28-22 at 1:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $5,000.00 cash  bond with the conditions that defendant is to have no contact with M.A.G., DOB: 02-25-2000 unless it regards child placement and no contact with C.A.S., DOB: 08-04-2019 unless approved by Manitowoc CPS.   Bail not furnished and defendant is remanded to the custody of the Sheriff.  
Minutes.

Order to Seal Probable Cause Statement.
